thoughtPairs.negative: I can't handle any more stress
thoughtPairs.positive: I have strategies to cope with stress effectively
I can break things down and handle one thing at a time

thoughtPairs.negative: Everyone else manages stress better than me
thoughtPairs.positive: Everyone has their own challenges and coping methods
Stressful periods are temporary and manageable

thoughtPairs.negative: I should be able to do it all
thoughtPairs.positive: It's okay to set boundaries and ask for help

thoughtPairs.negative: If I take a break, everything will fall apart
thoughtPairs.positive: Taking breaks helps me be more effective

thoughtPairs.negative: People will think I'm weak if I can't cope
thoughtPairs.positive: Setting limits shows self-awareness and wisdom

thoughtPairs.negative: I'm either completely relaxed or totally stressed
thoughtPairs.positive: Stress levels naturally fluctuate throughout the day

thoughtPairs.negative: I'll never learn to manage stress better
thoughtPairs.positive: I can develop and improve my coping skills over time
Feeling overwhelmed sometimes is a normal response

thoughtPairs.negative: One setback means I'm failing at managing stress
thoughtPairs.positive: Setbacks are normal parts of learning stress management

thoughtPairs.negative: Others can see how stressed I am
thoughtPairs.positive: Most people are focused on their own challenges

thoughtPairs.negative: Either I handle everything or I'm a failure
thoughtPairs.positive: I can prioritize what's most important
I can take steps to improve the situation

thoughtPairs.negative: I must always appear calm and collected
thoughtPairs.positive: It's okay to acknowledge when I'm feeling stressed
